contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} {{RomanMilitary}} The '''Vasconne cohort'' was a [[Basque people|Basque]] [[auxiliary (Roman military)|auxiliary]] [[infantry]] [[Cohort (military unit)|Cohort]] in the [[Roman Empire]]. This cohort spent many years guarding [[Hadrian's Wall]] in the north of [[Roman Britain|Britain]]. Also at some time in its history it earned the title fida or faithful for some now forgotten service to the emperor. There is some evidence for other Basque units that served guarding the empire as well.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vasconne Cohort}} [[Category:Auxiliary infantry units of ancient Rome]] {{Ancient-Rome-mil-stub}}
